intro: Lemboglossum galeottianum, commonly known as the Galeotti's lemboglossum, is a species of flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits. Lemboglossum galeottianum is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand saline conditions.
